column1: Check that these are included in master list
Croatia - Croatian Financial Services Supervisory Agency (HANFA)
Cyprus - Cyprus Securities and Exchange Commission (CySEC)
France - Prudential Supervision and Resolution Authority (ACPR)
Italy - Commissione Nazionale per le Società e la Borsa (CONSOB)
Latvia - Financial and Capital Market Commission (FCMC)
Luxembourg - Commission de Surveillance du Secteur Financier (CSSF)
Netherlands - Netherlands Authority for the Financial Markets (AFM)
European Central Bank (ECB) - Responsible for monetary policy and banking supervision for Eurozone banks. Oversees the Single Supervisory Mechanism.

European Banking Authority (EBA) - Develops regulatory standards and guidelines for EU banking sector and promotes convergence of supervisory practices. Part of European System of Financial Supervision.

European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) - Develops regulatory standards and guidelines for EU securities markets and promotes convergence of supervisory practices. Part of European System of Financial Supervision.

European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) - Develops regulatory standards and guidelines for EU insurance sector and promotes convergence of supervisory practices. Part of European System of Financial Supervision.
Single Resolution Board (SRB) - Responsible for resolution planning and resolving failing banks within the Banking Union.
European Systemic Risk Board (ESRB) - Responsible for macroprudential oversight of the EU financial system. Issues warnings and recommendations about systemic risks.
